intro: Thalictrum ametrum, commonly known as the meadow rue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces numerous stamens in its floral structure. Thalictrum ametrum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ecological benefits to pollinators.
